title: Jiří Skobla
text:
Jiří Skobla (6 April 1930 – 18 November 1978) was a <a href="Czechoslovakia">Czechoslovak</a> athlete who competed mainly in the <a href="shot%20put">shot put</a>. Born in <a href="Prague">Prague</a>, he was the son of former Olympic weightlifting champion <a href="Jaroslav%20Skobla">Jaroslav Skobla</a>.
His first success was a gold medal at the <a href="1954%20European%20Athletics%20Championships">1954 European Athletics Championships</a> – a feat that no other Czech has been able to replicate since. He was the bronze medallist at the event at the <a href="1958%20European%20Athletics%20Championships">1958 European Athletics Championships</a> and placed sixth in <a href="1962%20European%20Athletics%20Championships%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20shot%20put">1962</a>. He competed for <a href="Czechoslovakia%20at%20the%20Olympics">Czechoslovakia at the Olympics</a> on three occasions: 1952, 1956 and 1960. His best performance was in the <a href="1956%20Summer%20Olympics">1956 Summer Olympics</a> held in <a href="Melbourne">Melbourne</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>, where he won the <a href="bronze%20medal">bronze medal</a>. His final international medal, a bronze, came at the <a href="1966%20European%20Indoor%20Games">1966 European Indoor Games</a>.
Skobla died of <a href="kidney%20cancer">kidney cancer</a> in Prague. The autopsy results were not released, but it was widely believed his death may have been associated with steroid use.
